column1: The Argon is a powerful Wi-Fi enabled development kit that can act as either a standalone Wi-Fi endpoint or Wi-Fi enabled gateway for Particle Mesh networks. It is based on the Nordic nRF52840 and has built-in battery charging circuitry so it’s easy to connect a Li-Po and deploy your local network in minutes.
The Argon is great for connecting existing projects to the Particle Device Cloud or as a gateway to connect an entire group of local endpoints.
All Particle Hardware is designed from the ground up to work with the Device Cloud; a powerful set of tools and infrastructure to build
column3: and manage your IoT fleet. The Device Cloud for Particle Mesh will be priced by network. All Particle customers get 10 free micro networks using a Wi-Fi or Ethernet gateway. A micro network is defined as a network with 10 total devices and a single gateway. More pricing details to be released soon. In the meantime
column4: check out our documentation.

    - 802.11 b/g/n support

• Nordic Semiconductor nRF52840 SoC

    - ARM Cortex-M4F 32-bit processor @ 64MHz

    - 1MB flash

- NFC-A tag

column1: Note: Particle’s MVNO will provide support for LTE M1 connectivity in the US upon initial release. Not in the region? Check out the Boron 2G/3G Kit. See the cellular FAQ for details.

The Boron LTE is a powerful LTE CAT-M1/NB1 enabled development kit that can act as either a standalone cellular endpoint or LTE enabled gateway for Particle Mesh networks. It is based on the Nordic nRF52840 and has built-in battery charging circuitry so it’s easy to connect a Li-Po and deploy your local network in minutes.
The Boron is great for connecting existing projects to the Particle Device Cloud or as a gateway to connect an entire group of local endpoints where Wi-Fi is missing or unreliable.
All Particle hardware is designed from the ground up to work with the Device Cloud; a powerful set of tools and infrastructure to build
column3: and manage your IoT fleet. The Device Cloud for Particle Mesh will be priced by network. All Particle customers get 3 free months of Device Cloud access for micro networks using a cellular gateway. A micro network is defined as a network with 10 total devices and a single gateway. More pricing details to be released soon. In the meantime

column1: The Xenon is a low cost mesh-enabled development kit that can act as either an endpoint or repeater within a Particle Mesh network.

The Xenon is mesh only and designed to function as the endpoint of your IoT network. It is based on the Nordic nRF52840 and has built-in battery charging circuitry so it’s easy to connect a Li-Po and deploy your local network in minutes.
The Xenon is best for connecting sensors
column5: and points of data-interest. Pair it with an Argon or Boron gateway to get all that great data into the Device Cloud.

column1: The INA219 FeatherWing makes power-monitoring problems a thing of the past. Instead of struggling with two multimeters
column2: you can just use the handy INA219B chip on this breakout to measure both the high side voltage and DC current draw over I2C with 1% precision. Works with all Feather boards including the new Particle Argon

column1: This chip is smarter than your average current-measuring devices. It can handle high side current measuring
column3: even though it is powered with 3.3V. It will also report back that high side voltage
column4: which is great for tracking battery life or solar panels. Communicates over I2C and possible to change the I2C address to have up to 4 of these Wings on one Feather.

column1: See the full specs at Adafruit.

column1: This is the FeatherWing OLED: it adds a 128x32 monochrome OLED plus 3 user buttons to any Feather main board including the new Particle Argon

These displays are about 1" diagonal and very readable due to the high contrast of an OLED display. This screen is made of 128x32 individual white OLED pixels that provide a crisp display. Includes a reset button and three mini tactile buttons (A
column3: and C) so you can add a mini user interface to your feather. Works with all Feather boards and stacks with FeatherWings
column4: using only the two I2C pins.

column1: This is the Power Relay FeatherWing. It gives you power to control...well power. Turn on and off lamps

column1: Each FeatherWing comes with a fully assembled and tested PCB header you can use to attach to your Feather. By soldering closed the jumper on the underside of the Wing
column2: you can select which pin you want to use for the relay control. Some light soldering is required.

column1: This Wing has a non-latching type relay. You can switch up to 10A of resistive-load current at 120VAC
column4: about half that. Please note: If using with high voltages (> 24V) use care and common sense. High voltages require experience
column5: and are only for use by engineers who are comfortable with guidelines and know how to use them safely.

Grove Starter Kit for Particle Mesh Explore the world of sensing with Particle Mesh 35 Grove_Starter_Kit_large.jpg "

*Now available to order
column2: shipping November 2018. If you add additional items to your order
column3: your entire order will not ship until November 2018.*

column1: Please note the Grove Starter Kit does not include a Particle development board. You will need to purchase a Particle Mesh Argon or Boron to accompany this kit.

The Starter Kit is designed to make your first exploration into the world of sensing and actuating a breeze. The kit comes with seven different components that work out-of-the-box with Particle Mesh hardware and let you focus on learning the basics. Working with Starter Kit requires no soldering and minimal wiring. Simply connect the kit’s Grove Shield (the new co-developed FeatherWing adapter from Particle and Grove) to your Particle Mesh board and use the included cables to connect the adapter and the sensors and actuators that you want to use. It’s a plug-and-play experience.
<li><span>Grove Shield for Particle Mesh - Plug and play your Particle Mesh Argon or Boron in the FeatherWing form factor; includes Grove connectors (3 Digital
• Button - A momentary push button that uses Standard 4-pin Grove Cables to connect to other Grove modules
<li><span>Rotary Angle Sensor - Also known as a ‘potentiometer’
column2: this sensor produces analog output between 0 and Vcc

column1: • Ultrasonic Ranger - A non-contact distance measurement module working at 40KHz
• Temp&Humi Sensor - Highly reliable and integrated temperature and humidity sensor
• Light Sensor v1.2 - Integrates a photo-resistor to detect light intensity and can be used to build a light controlled switch
• Chainable RGB LED - Full-color LED driver with 3 constant-current drivers as well as modulated output of 256 shades of gray
• Buzzer - Easy to use piezoelectric buzzer with a sound output of >85dB
• 4-Digit Display - Red alpha-numeric display with 8 adjustable luminance levels

column1: The E Series Evaluation Kit contains a breakout board which provides easy access to all the pins and peripherals available on all E Series module variants. The Evaluation Board includes:

column1: The Photon is a $19 tiny Wi-Fi IoT device for creating connected projects and products for the Internet of Things. It's easy to use
column3: and it's connected to the cloud. The board itself uses a Cypress Wi-Fi chip (one that can be found in Nest Protect
column5: and Amazon Dash) alongside a powerful STM32 ARM Cortex M3 microcontroller. It's like the Spark Core. But better.

column1: The tools that make up the Photon's ecosystem (and come along with the board) are designed to let you build and create whether you're an embedded engineer
column3: Arduino enthusiast or IoT entrepreneur. You'll be able to write your firmware in our web or local IDE
column5: and build your web and mobile apps with ParticleJS and our Mobile SDKs.

P1 - Particle Wi-Fi Module with Antenna	Next generation MCU + Wi-Fi module with FCC certification and built-in antenna	12	P1_DSC3791_large.jpg	"<meta charset=""utf-8"">
P1s ship in strips of 10. Price is per module and must be ordered in multiples of 10.

Thinking of transitioning from your Photon-powered prototype into mass production? The P1 is your answer. It's Particle's tiny Wi-Fi module that contains both the Cypress Wi-Fi chip and a reprogrammable STM32 32-bit ARM Cortex-M3 microcontroller. The P1 comes pre-loaded with Particle firmware.
The P1 has a built-in antenna and a uFL connector
column2: so you don't have to stress over the optimization of RF designs. This module is FCC-certified
column3: and has additional external flash to accommodate super-hardcore projects.

RedBear Duo (Wi-Fi + BLE) A Wi-Fi + Bluetooth BLE development kit with the Particle Cloud 24.9 redbearduo_thumbnail_large.jpg "

The RedBear Duo with Headers will be available in late October. The RedBear Duo without Headers is available and comes with headers included but not soldered on.
The RedBear Duo is a Wi-Fi + Bluetooth Low-Energy (BLE) development kit. The RedBear Duo leverages its Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connections to connect to the Particle Cloud
column2: publish and subscribe to online events
column4:
and update firmware over the air.

The Duo is perfect for applications where you want to leverage BLE for low-power local communications with other BLE sensors and devices with the flexibility of waking up Wi-Fi to send data and communications back to the Cloud on a regular interval. Best of all
column5: the RedBear Duo is compatible with all Particle development tools

column1: This board can ship with or without headers. Units with headers are great for using with breadboards; units without headers are best for surface mounting and special applications.

• Broadcom BCM43438 Wi-Fi 802.11n (2.4GHz only) + Bluetooth 4.1 (Dual Mode) combo chip
• Integrated chip antenna with the option to connect external antenna
• Small single-sided PCB for easy mounting on other PCB boards

Visit https://github.com/redbear/Duo for detailed setup and troubleshooting instructions.

Power Shield	Easily add and monitor power with this shield that ships along with a 3.7V Li-Po battery	25	PowerShield_DSC3750_large.jpg	"<meta charset=""utf-8"">
The Power Shield is the best way to—you guessed it—provide power to your mobile Particle projects. Based around the MCP73871 battery management controller
column2: this shield allows you to simultaneously power a Photon and charge a connected Li-Ion or Li-Po battery. You'll also be able to monitor battery levels using the Photon itself
column3: which makes the Power Shield the best way to untether your wireless project.

column2: you can also use an external DC power supply or solar-cell to charge the battery.

column1: This shield ships with a 3.7V Li-Po battery and headers.
• Operating voltage: USB or External DC of 7 to 20V

Programmer Shield Access your Photon's memory space with this standalone JTAG programmer 30 150802_Particle-20_large.jpg "

The new and improved Programmer Shield is essentially a USB-JTAG converter that gives advanced users complete access to the Photon's memory space. It supports openOCD and the WICED SDK
column2: and is built around the FT2232H high speed USB FIFO.
it is fully standalone and requires no third-party programmers.

column1: In addition to providing a JTAG interface
column2: this shield can also act as a USB to Serial converter. You can also use this shield as a generic JTAG programmer for your other projects!

column1:
Relay Shield Regulate the power to a variety of electronics with this four relay shield 30 150802_Particle-17_large.jpg "

The Relay Shield allows you to control any normal outlet or high voltage product from anywhere. The shield comes with four relays that are rated at a max of 220V @10Amp allowing you to control any electric appliance rated at under 2000 Watts.
Note that you *will* need a DC adapter to power the relays! We recommend this one.
• Compatible with both the Core and the Photon.

Wi-Fi Antennas Add additional range to your Photon or Core uFL with a Flex or Duck Antenna 10 150802_Particle-15_large.jpg "

These external antennas are the perfect way to extend the wireless range of your Particle-powered Wi-Fi project.
The ultra portable Flex Antenna is particularly useful when space is at a premium
column2: but you want a little more range than a chip or trace antenna can provide. It requires no additional connector — it attaches directly to the u.FL connector already on your Core u.FL or Photon.

column1: The Duck Antenna is especially great for projects that need a metallic enclosure
column2: which often block Wi-Fi transmission. The antenna includes an interface cable for RP-SMA to u.FL. The Duck Antenna can be used with the Photon as well as Cores with u.FL connectors.

column1:
Cellular Antenna Add an extra Taoglas GSM antenna to improve reception in cellular projects 10 Antenna_large_50fba6d2-294b-472f-994d-de78d546c3e0_large.jpg "

This penta-band GSM antenna from industry leader Taoglas is a great multi-purpose antenna for almost all cellular applications. It's compact size makes it convenient for design into small enclosures
column2: and it features a rigid structure that ensures minimal gain loss during integration.

column1: This antenna attaches directly to the u.FL connector on the Electron
column2: and is the same antenna that we include with all of our Electron development kits. RoHS compliant
column3: and includes 3M adhesive for easy integration into enclosures.

column1: Find the complete datasheet for the antenna
